title: Looking for 2 font types
author: bzpilot

comments.content:
For the 2nd one:  
 **[BonJovi](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317124523/http:/www.dafont.com/search.php?text=CHURCHILL%27S&q=BonJovi)** a Dafont.com font with no designer/foundry information

BonJovi looks like as somebody took the **[Metra Serif (Bold)](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317124523/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/wiescherdesign/metra-serif/)** by Gert Wiescher [Wiescher Design, 2009], expand it by 200% and added the spurs.  
It's also possible that the two fonts share a common pre-digital source, I don't know...

Top one looks like Algerian

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317124523im_/http:/typophile.com/files/AlgerianInUse_6299.jpg)
http://www.myfonts.com/search/Algerian/fonts/ but may be modified to make it a lighter weight.  
A 19th century type design by Stephenson Blake digitized by Letraset, and others.  
Don
That BonJovi is awful. Tell me that's not an actual logo, BZ.
